title: R-Ladies San Diego: UseR! 2020 tutorial: Easy Larger-than-RAM  data manipulation  with disk.frame
description:
Hey everyone,

As most of you know, UseR! 2020 is happening online this year. Further, this year the conference tutorials will be done in partnership with R-Ladies Global, MiR, and the AfricaR user group.

The AWESOME news is that our group, R-Ladies San Diego, has been chosen to host one of the UseR! tutorials this year! We are really excited to bring this opportunity to our members and to other R enthusiasts from all over the world!

The tutorial we are hosting will be presented by disk.frame creator Zhuo Jia Dai (ZJ). He'll tell us more about "Easy Larger-than-RAM data manipulation with disk.frame".

Here's ZJ's description: In this tutorial, we will present the {disk.frame} (diskframe.com) R package for handling datasets that are too large for RAM but still fits comfortably on your hard drive. We will go through how {disk.frame} works, how to manipulate ten's of gigabytes of data without using all your RAM, and how you can take advantage of the many CPU cores on your computer by parallelizing data manipulation task using {disk.frame}. Also, I will show you how to perform all the standard data manipulations by using just dplyr verbs! After the tutorial, you should be able to confidently tackle dataset up to ten's of gigabytes in size comfortably on your laptop.

I really hope you can all make it to our very first online event. This is such an amazing opportunity for all of us! Hopefully useR! 2020 will allow many that might not have been able to attend such a conference in person to join us in our exploration of the R universe.

We really look forward to (virtually) seeing everyone again soon!

Your R-Ladies SD organizers

title: R-Ladies San Diego: Combined July Meetup! San Diego useR / Boston useR / South Coast MA useR
description:
Hey all!

Our fellow R enthusiasts from San Diego R Users Groups have invited us to join their upcoming meetup. I'm really excited to participate and get to know even more awesome R lovers!

I hope to see you all there,

Juliana

Posted from San Diego R Users Groups:

Coast to Coast for this summer meetup! July's meetup will feature 3 useR Groups!

Greater Boston useR: https://www.meetup.com/Boston-useR/
San Diego useR: https://www.meetup.com/sd-r-users/
South Coast MA useR: https://www.meetup.com/South-Coast-useR-Group

Talk #1: Andrew Bates, Databases With R:

Using databases directly within R can greatly streamline your workflow. In this talk we will learn how to query databases and return the results as an R data frame. We will show how packages like DBI and dbplyr allow us to use dplyr syntax to run queries against a database and return the results. This allows us to keep our workflow entirely within R, instead of switching contexts between SQL and R. After looking at a few examples, we will cover some tips for incorporating these ideas into our daily work as well as resources for moving beyond the basics.

Talk #2: Asmae Toumi, naniar package:

Asmae Toumi will give a very broad overview of how to leverage the {naniar} package to explore and visualize missing data, identify patterns of missing data, and impute missing data using the {MICE} package.

Talk #3: Amanda Hart, Tips & tricks for making your own R package:

From plotting to analysis, packages are foundational tools for R users. But what happens when there isn‚Äôt an existing package to meet your needs? In this talk, we will learn how to take your own code and turn it into a new R package. We will provide simple steps to get started and tips to add features as you become package-building experts.

Talk #4: Juliana Capitanio, Flexdashboards: Using interactive dashboards to create data visualizations

Juliana Capitanio will show us how to use R Markdown to quickly create a dashboard using the flexdashboards package. These dashboards can compile plots, tables, gauges, value boxes, text annotations and maps into various layouts. Dashboard components are responsive and quickly resize to fit mobile devices. Further, we can easily make dashboard elements interactive by using htmlwidgets for R and/or Shiny.

title: R-Ladies Johannesburg: useR! 2020: Create and share reproducible code with R Markdown and workflowr
description:
We are proud to host the tutorial as a part of useR!2020. We have limited slots for the tutorial (only 8 for our group), so please only register if you are going to attend. Further to this, we are giving preference to women and minority genders for our slots, so if you are a male member of our group please head over to eSwatini RUG meetup page (https://www.meetup.com/EswatiniUseR/) (https://www.meetup.com/EswatiniUseR/events/271981460/), or Botswana RUG meetup page (https://www.meetup.com/Botswana-R-Users/) (https://www.meetup.com/Botswana-R-Users/events/271985777/) as they will also be hosting with us.

Please note: We are opening up *15* spots and we will be choosing **8** from them who will attend the workshop. The others will be wait-listed in the event someone drops off the attendees list.

Description:
Have you ever struggled to re-run your own code or scripts you received from a collaborator? You‚Äôre not alone! Fortunately, there are simple practices that you can use to help you develop more reproducible R code. In this tutorial, you will 1) explore some of the common causes of non-reproducible code, 2) gain practical experience fixing reproducibility issues, and 3) use the R package workflowr (https://jdblischak.github.io/workflowr/) to facilitate creation of more reproducible and shareable code. The tutorial will be hands-on and interactive, with small-group exercises.

Prerequisites:
Participants should have some experience using R (e.g. importing data from a file, loading a package). The tutorial will involve running R code in R Markdown files from the RStudio IDE. If you are unfamiliar with R Markdown, we recommend reviewing these short guides before participating in the tutorial: [Introduction](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-1.html), [How It Works](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-2.html), [Code Chunks](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-3.html].

Requirements:
A web browser, an account on GitHub (https://github.com/), and an account on RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/). We will email you the tutorial materials.

Instructors:
Dr. John Blischak received his PhD in Genetics from the University of Chicago. He is the author of the CRAN package workflowr, and has years of experience performing reproducible data analysis with R, R Markdown, and Git. He is a certified Software Carpentry Instructor, and has taught over 10 workshops for researchers covering topics such as Bash, Python, R, and Git.

Dr. Peter Carbonetto, a co-author of the workflowr R package, is a research staff scientist in the Human Genetics Department and the cross-disciplinary Research Computing Center at the University of Chicago. He has a background in computer science and machine learning, and currently does research at the interface of genetics, statistics, and computer science. He frequently gives R and bioinformatics skills workshops at the University of Chicago.

It will be an online meetup, and the link will be sent to successful attendees via email.

All Information: https://bit.ly/2WqAfNy

title: R-Ladies Cape Town: GBV Prevalence in Kenya: Caroline Akoth (Women in GIS Kenya)
description:
Caroline Akoth is a spatial data scientist and the director of operations and advocacy at Women in GIS Kenya (@WiGISKe on Twitter/ https://wigis.co.ke/). In this talk, she will be sharing their work on mapping gender-based violence in Kenya.

"Gender based violence in Kenya is a health indicator that investigates sexual or physical abuse of persons based on their gender.
SDG 5 on Gender Equality targets to have 0 % prevalence of GBV cases globally. Locally the national policy on prevention and response to GBV hopes to achieve 25 % Prevalence in the next year.
This presentation will look at reporting GBV prevalence in Kenya while highlighting notable trends in counties.
The aim of this project is to further look at how far the country is at achieving 25% Prevalence goal set by the national policy." - Caroline Akoth

After witnessing her informative, moving and empowering talk at satRday2020 in Joburg, we are thrilled to have her back to share her work with our members. We hope that those of you interested in giving a voice to issues affecting South African womxn will be inspired, motivated and equipped to do so!

Please join via the Google Hangouts link. Please MUTE your microphone when you join!

title: R-Ladies Mendoza: Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles - useR! 2020 tutorial
description:
Los cap√≠tulos de R-Ladies en Argentina estamos felices de anunciar que Emil Hvitfeldt y Julia Silge se unir√°n a nosotras para traernos su tutorial "Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles".

¬øAlguna vez encontraste datos de texto y sospechaste que hab√≠a informaci√≥n √∫til en esos datos?, ¬ø Te sentiste con frustraci√≥n al intentan ver c√≥mo encontrar esa informaci√≥n? ¬øEst√°s familiarizade con los conceptos b√°sicos del modelado predictivo y est√°s liste para aprender c√≥mo se pueden usar los datos de texto no estructurados para la predicci√≥n dentro de los ecosistemas tidyverse y tidymodels?

¬øNecesitas un marco flexible para manejar datos de texto que te permitan construir modelos predictivos supervisados?
Los datos de texto son cada vez m√°s importantes en muchos dominios, y los principios de tidymodels se pueden aplicar a las tareas de procesamiento del lenguaje natural. Esta presentaci√≥n est√° dise√±ada para proporcionar orientaci√≥n pr√°ctica y conocimiento directamente aplicable para cient√≠fiques de datos y analistas que desean integrar texto en sus proyectos de modelado.

En este tutorial de 90 minutos, aprende a preprocesar datos de texto para modelar, entrenar modelos y evaluar el rendimiento del modelo. Usaremos diapositivas y codificaci√≥n en vivo durante el tutorial para recorrer un estudio de caso realista. El tutorial se transmitir√°, grabar√° y tendr√° subt√≠tulos en ingl√©s. Tambi√©n habr√° materiales de apoyo y c√≥digo en GitHub para que puedas trabajar despu√©s.

El tutorial est√° pensando para personas con familiaridad intermedia con R, RStudio, conceptos b√°sicos de modelos de regresi√≥n y clasificaci√≥n y paquetes de tidyverse como dplyr y ggplot2.

Como en todos los eventos de R-Ladies, las personas que participan deben aceptar nuestro C√≥digo de Conducta. Para este evento, adem√°s adoptamos el C√≥digo de Conducta de useR! 2020.

****** IMPORTANTE ******
Para participar y acceder al link de Zoom que publicaremos media hora antes del evento es necesario que hagas click en el bot√≥n "ASISTIR√â".

- English versi√≥n

This useR! 2020 online tutorial is coming Friday, July 24, 2020 at 14:00 UTC The R-Ladies chapters from Argentina are happy to announce that Emil Hvitfeldt and Julia Silge will be joining us to run their tutorial "Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles".

Have you ever encountered text data and suspected there was useful insight latent within it but felt frustrated about how to find that insight?
Are you familiar with the basics of predictive modeling, and ready to learn how unstructured text data can be used for prediction within the tidyverse and tidymodels ecosystems?
Do you need a flexible framework for handling text data that empowers you to build supervised predictive models?
Text data is increasingly important in many domains, and tidy modeling principles can be applied to natural language processing tasks. This presentation is designed to provide practical guidance and directly applicable knowledge for data scientists and analysts who want to integrate text into their modeling pipelines.

In this 90-minute tutorial, learn how to preprocess text data for modeling, train models, and evaluate model performance. We will use slides and live coding during the tutorial to walk through a realistic case study. The tutorial will be streamed, recorded, and captioned, and there will be supporting materials and code on GitHub for you to work through afterward.

The tutorial is intended for people with intermediate familiarity with R, RStudio, basics of regression and classification modeling, and tidyverse packages such as dplyr and ggplot2.

As every R-Ladies event, all participants are required to agree to the Code of Conduct. In addition, we also adopt the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct.

****** NOTICE ******
To participate and accesses to the Zoom link that will be published 30 minutes before the meetup, you have to click on the ATTEND button.

title: R-Ladies Washington D.C.: Writing a federal resume
description: Kathryn Troutman is the federal resume writing guru: https://resume-place.com/about/kathryn-troutman/. In this meetup, she will introduce us to the federal resume that she helped design, and lead us through several examples of federal resumes. She has over 30 years experience in this field, and has written over 30 books on this topic. She is currently creating a new course in Udemy about resume writing, federal resume writing and how to apply to all of the new COVID-19 Federal and state jobs. Kathryn is a sage who will gently guide us through this difficult process.

title: R-Ladies Washington D.C.: Books In Bars - Rodham
description:
Spend Friday night discussing Rodham (https://bookshop.org/books/rodham/9780399590917).

From the New York Times bestselling author of American Wife and Eligible, a novel that imagines a deeply compelling what-might-have-been: What if Hillary Rodham hadn't married Bill Clinton?

In 1971, Hillary Rodham is a young woman full of promise: Life magazine has covered her Wellesley commencement speech, she's attending Yale Law School, and she's on the forefront of student activism and the women's rights movement. And then she meets Bill Clinton. A handsome, charismatic southerner and fellow law student, Bill is already planning his political career. In each other, the two find a profound intellectual, emotional, and physical connection that neither has previously experienced.

In the real world, Hillary followed Bill back to Arkansas, and he proposed several times; although she said no more than once, as we all know, she eventually accepted and became Hillary Clinton.

But in Curtis Sittenfeld's powerfully imagined tour-de-force of fiction, Hillary takes a different road. Feeling doubt about the prospective marriage, she endures their devastating breakup and leaves Arkansas. Over the next four decades, she blazes her own trail--one that unfolds in public as well as in private, that involves crossing paths again (and again) with Bill Clinton, that raises questions about the tradeoffs all of us must make in building a life.

Brilliantly weaving a riveting fictional tale into actual historical events, Curtis Sittenfeld delivers an uncannily astute and witty story for our times. In exploring the loneliness, moral ambivalence, and iron determination that characterize the quest for political power, as well as both the exhilaration and painful compromises demanded of female ambition in a world still run mostly by men, Rodham is a singular and unforgettable novel.
PS Please contact the organizer if you need support finding the book.

title: R-Ladies Washington D.C.: Exploring Weight Loss Maintenance Through Experiments
description:
Abstract:
I explore a theory of goal maintenance which states that individuals who achieve significant goals ‚Äì such as getting out of debt, becoming sober, or losing a substantial amount of weight ‚Äì are more likely to maintain the progress achieved if they frequently think about the person they were in the past, before meeting the goal, and make downward comparisons between their present self and their past, pre-goal self. In this talk, I will discuss two studies used to test this theory for weight loss maintenance, including an observational study using data from Reddit and a randomized controlled experiment using an Amazon Mechanical Turk population. I will also discuss R methods used to parse through semi-structured data, perform regression analyses and hypothesis tests, and visualize results.

Bio:
Elicia John is a Behavioral Data Scientist. Her research focuses on consumer well-being and decision making, and she works to uncover insights that will help consumers live healthier, happier, and more productive lives. Her work has been presented at national and international conferences ‚Äì including the Association for Consumer Research Conference, the Society for Consumer Psychology Conference, and the Race in the Marketplace Forum ‚Äì and published in the Policy Insights from the Behavioral and Brain Sciences journal. Prior to pursuing doctoral studies, Elicia worked as a data scientist and management consultant. She helped stakeholders and clients in public, private, and non-profit sector organizations improve business operations and develop effective policy and strategy. She currently holds Ph.D. and Master of Science degrees in Management (Consumer Behavior and Decision Making) from UCLA, a Master in Public Policy degree from Harvard University, and a Bachelor of Science degree from the University of Maryland, College Park in engineering.

title: Seattle useR Group (R Programming Language): Case Studies: R in Sport
description:
Seattle is home to lots of bright minds in data analytics. This upcoming meetup we have 2 speakers that also happen to be part of our favorite local NHL Franchise, and great people to learn from. Namita Nandakumar and Dani Chu will be giving some fun presentation on R in Sport!

This meetup will be online and a link will be shared here before the event.

** Note that this not work related to NHL Seattle

Putting the Fun in Functional Data: A tidy pipeline to identify routes in NFL tracking data - Dani Chu
Currently in football many hours are spent watching game film to manually label the routes run on passing plays. Using tracking data, each route can be described as a sequence of spatial-temporal measurements that varies in length depending on the duration of the play. This data can be conveniently analyzed using nested columns in tidyr and purrr. We demonstrate how model-based curve clustering using Bernstein polynomial basis functions (i.e. B√©zier curves) fit using the Expectation Maximization algorithm can cluster route trajectories. Each cluster can then be labelled to obtain route names for each route and create route trees for all receivers. The clusters and routes can be visualized nicely using ggplot and seen developing over time using gganimate.

R + Tidyverse in Sports - Namita Nandakumar
This talk will use a case study, most likely in hockey, to showcase the many ways in which R and the Tidyverse can be used to analyze sports data as well as the unique priorities and considerations that are involved in applying statistical tools to sports problems.

title: R-Ladies Los Angeles: useR2020 Tutorial: "Causal Inference in R" (General signup)
description:
RLadies LA is teaming up with this year's virtual useR! 2020 conference to host a casual inference tutorial hosted by Dr. Lucy D'Agostino McGowan and Dr. Malcom Barrett! See bottom of post for important logistical details.

Description: In both data science and academic research, prediction modeling is often not enough; to answer many questions, we need to approach them causally. In this workshop, we‚Äôll teach the essential elements of answering causal questions in R through causal diagrams, and causal modeling techniques such as propensity scores and inverse probability weighting. We‚Äôll also show that by distinguishing predictive models from causal models, we can better take advantage of both tools. You‚Äôll be able to use the tools you already know--the tidyverse, regression models, and more--to answer the questions that are important to your work.

Audience: This tutorial will appeal to statisticians and data scientists interested in taking their inference to the next level, incorporating causal techniques.

Logistical notes:
* This page is for **general audience** sign-up.
* We have a separate sign-up page (here: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-la/events/271923710/) for anyone who identifies as part of an **underrepresented group**. Please RSVP on only one page. Thank you for helping us support diversity in #rstats!
* The tutorial will have live closed captioning available (you can turn it on from within Zoom)
* The Zoom room will have a password, which we will email to attendees before the event. Please check your email so that you can join us!

Questions? Leave a comment or send us a message!

See you on July 27!

Your RLadies LA hosts,
Amanda & Katie

title: R-Ladies Rio de Janeiro: Do script ao pacote de R
R-Ladies Tbilisi: Webinar: Working with text in R
description:
R-Ladies Tbilisi is pleased to host Ella Kaye.
Ella is a PhD student in Statistics at the University of Warwick. She followed her undergraduate degree in Mathematics and Philosophy with Masters degrees in History and Philosophy of Science and then Mathematics Education. Her interest in statistics was first piqued as a secondary school maths teacher when thinking about how to make the subject interesting for teenagers. An MSc in Applied Statistics followed (via a couple of years in working in market research), which lead to the PhD. Ella is an R enthusiast and package author, and the co-organiser of the Oxford R User Group.

R provides excellent tools for working with text. This tidyverse-based talk will provide an overview of some of the fantastic packages available for this, including (but not limited to) `stringr`, `RVerbalExpressions`, `tidytext` and `wordcloud`.

Please register here to receive the event link: https://tinyurl.com/tbsreg

title: R-Ladies Tbilisi: Webinar: Finding hidden topics in documents and other text analyses in R
description:
Roc√≠o Joo (University of Florida) will present a procedure to identify topics in a set of documents using an example of scientific articles in a field of science, movement ecology. To tell the whole story behind this case study, she will briefly explain how she addressed the identification of the papers of interest, show some code for downloading articles, extracting the text and finally perform data analysis. The latter will mainly consist of fitting Latent Dirichlet Allocation models to identify the latent or hidden topics.
If there will be time, she will also talk about other types of text analysis.

Roc√≠o is an ecological statistician, currently working as a postdoctoral research associate at University of Florida, investigating animal movement models, and other quantitative methods and R tools to analyze movement. She recently published a scientific article examining R packages for movement (https://arxiv.org/abs/1901.05935) and maintains a CRAN Task View of those packages (https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/Tracking.html) . She is part of R-ladies and participates in the Latin American R community.
https://rociojoo.github.io/

Please register here to receive the event link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/11bZ_ASK7VlAst7Rwxyt_H9ZYWHediDKgzGynP8bek1g .

Elvira Nassirova will give an overview of a data analyst's toolkit - which tools to use and why, and what kind of tasks a data analyst does. The second part of the talk will be about how to gather and analyze public data and stay objective.
Elvira Nassirova is from Kazakhstan and based in Tbilisi. She works as Data Analyst at Railsware and as mentor at Yandex.Praktikum. Elvira uses R for data processing, exploration, visualization, web scraping and automation. Elvira loves R for its beautiful structure, dataviz tools, and of course, for its lovely community!

https://github.com/bjolko/

Please register here to receive the event link: https://tinyurl.com/tbsreg.

title: R-Ladies Jakarta: 8th Meetup: Intro to Twitter Mining & Visualization for Likert-Scale Survey Data
description:
Hello again, R enthusiasts!!! After a five-month hiatus, we're finally having out eighth meetup, real soon!

WHEN?
Saturday, 18th of July 2020 from 2 pm - 5 pm WIB.

WHERE?
We'll be live on Zoom. Please RSVP here and also fill up this form https://bit.ly/rladiesjktreg so that we can email you the meeting ID and password.

AGENDA:
We'll cover new materials about an introduction to twitter mining in R (by Erika Siregar) and Visualization for Likert-Scale Survey Data (by Ulfah Mardhiah).

Interested? Hurry up and register then! It'll be great if you already have a twitter account.

Some IMPORTANT stuff:
1. We can only host 90 attendances.
2. Check previous meetups docs here: https://github.com/RLadiesJakarta
3. E-mail us at [masked] for any inquiries regarding this event!
4. Follow our social media @rladiesjakarta (twitter) and @rladiesjkt (instagram).
5. Don't forget to have RStudio readily installed in your computer
6. If you're very new to R, you can also go through these two documents before the meetup:
1. Intro to R.pdf
2. Starter Kit R.pdf
You can download and read the descriptions here: https://github.com/RLadiesJakarta/starter-kit

title: R-Ladies Dallas: Data Analysis with R - Class Project Selection
description:
I'm excited about our plan to enhance our programming skills through an online learning experience. As a group, we decided that we will focus on the "Data Analysis with R" course taught by Facebook instructors on the Udacity learning platform. This will ensure that we are all on the same page when we're ready to kick off our R-Ladies Dallas group project. The course is available for free at the following link: https://www.udacity.com/course/data-analysis-with-r--ud651

In this meetup, we will discuss any remaining questions that you may have about the course material. We will discuss options for our the class project.

*** CLASS PROJECT ***

To help us all get a firmer understanding of the concepts learned in the course, we have decided to work on a class project. Members have already started to post suggestions in the Slack channel.

To prepare for the event, please come with suggestions as to a specific dataset and use case that you think would be a good fit for our meetup project. An ideal project would allow us to grow our skills in most of these areas.

* Data loading
* Data manipulation
* Data visualization
* Single variable analysis
* Bivariate analysis

*************************

Please join the #learning channel in our R-Ladies Dallas Slack community so that we can discuss the course and ask/answer questions you may have about the material. Slack sign-up info provided below.

Agenda
------------------------------
Part 1: Lessons 1 - 4
Part 2: Lessons 5 - 8
Part 3: Lessons 9 - 10
Class Project < -------- this meetup event

Also, please take time to watch the videos and work through the exercises.

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the webinar series and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Webinar + Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

About R-Ladies Dallas

R-Ladies Dallas welcomes members of all R proficiency levels, whether you're a new or aspiring R user, or an experienced R programmer interested in mentoring, networking & expert upskilling. Our non-profit, civil society community is designed to develop our members' R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community!

A local chapter of R-Ladies Global, R-Ladies Dallas exists to promote gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R. As a founding principle, there is no cost or charge to participate in any of our R-Ladies communities around the world.

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals.

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: R-Ladies Milan: Donne e data science: come trovare la tua strada
description:
Donne e data science: come trovare la tua strada. Round table con 6 data scientists con background e profili professionali diversi.

L'evento √® aperto a tutti e a tutti i livelli di esperienza. L'evento √® gratuito, in lingua italiana e prevede il seguente programma:
-45‚Äô di discussione in cui 6 donne nel mondo della data science racconteranno le loro esperienze. Quali professioni ci sono e come capire il ruolo pi√π adatto in un team di Data Science? Quali sono le differenze tra il mondo professionale e l‚Äôambiente accademico? Quali risorse utilizzare per imparare e su quali skills focalizzarsi? Rimanere in Italia o cercare un lavoro all‚Äôestero? Quali sono le principali applicazioni di data science nell'industria? E' necessario avere un profilo tecnico per avere una carriera nel data science?
- 30‚Äô di Q&A session (sessione di domande&risposte) in cui risponderemo alle vostre domande.

Speakers:

- Sara Iacozza: Dottorata in psicologia cognitiva e neuroscienze, lavora come data storyteller per /Data. Si occupa di ricerca di mercato e produce business insights utilizzando dati quantitativi e storytelling.
- Giovanna de Vincenzo: Data scientist specializzata in Data Visualization per il business, ha conseguito il master Big Data in Business per Data Scientist
- Parvaneh Shafiei: Senior data scientist con oltre 5 anni di esperienza nell'applicazione di Machine Learning, Intelligenza artificiale e analisi avanzata per problemi aziendali
- Oriana Angelucci: √® una Senior business translator. Ha lavorato nella ricerca di mercato e ora si √® concentrata sulla trasformazione basata sui dati di Customer Relationship Management attraverso l'applicazione di analisi avanza
- Cristina Muschitiello: Phd in Statistica Metodologica, R-Developer, Ricercatore e Data Scientist. Attualmente Data Scientist presso infocamere, collabora altres√¨ con il Consiglio per la ricerca in agricoltura e l'analisi dell'economia agraria (CREA) dove si occupa di statistiche per l'agricoltura
- Francesca Rosa: Associate Statistician @ UNODC

Vi aspettiamo!

title: R-Ladies Milan: Root cause analysis using frequent pattern discovery (Machine learning usecase)
description:
Hi everybody,
Before jumping to the summer's holiday, wanted to organize another meetup, and here we are!
In this meetup, we are hosting Golnaz, she is a data scientist working for Altran Italia. During this meet up she will:
- Discuss practical steps to start a career in data science and opportunities in Altran.
- Present a real use case on pattern mining. An approach used to developing a semi-supervised ML model for root cause analysis and finding correlations in data.
Wanna learn more? Join us at online meetup!
With RSVP Yes, you will receive the link for joining to us online.

title: R-Ladies New York: [Online event] Q&A with Authors of "Build a Career in Data Science"
description:
Authors of "Build a Career in Data Science" Emily Robinson and Jacqueline Nolis will read selections from their book and discuss why they were meaningful and what thinking went into making it. In this session you‚Äôll learn about some of the higher-level thinking that went into designing a book to help people excel in their data science careers, as well as hear stories from Emily and Jacqueline‚Äôs pasts that ended up shaping the narrative. After Emily and Jacqueline discuss their book, the floor will open so anyone can ask their data science career questions!

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page and sent to all attendees at noon on the day of the event. *Note: Please check your spam or "Promotions" tab (if a Gmail user) for this Meetup announcement email if it does not appear in your inbox. Email [masked] prior to the event if you do not receive it.*

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:40: Emily & Jacqueline talk about their book
7:40-8:15: Audience Q&A
8:15-8:20: Wrap-up

--- Speaker Bios ---

Emily Robinson is a senior data scientist at Warby Parker, where she works on a centralized team tackling some of the company's projects. She previously worked at DataCamp, where she built and ran their experimentation analytics system, and at Etsy, where she worked with their search team.

Dr. Jacqueline Nolis is a principal data scientist at Brightloom where she creates models to help restaurants and retailers improve the customer experience. She has a PhD in Industrial Engineering, and has over a decade of experience with helping companies use data, ranking from DSW to Airbnb. For fun Jacqueline likes to use data science for humor‚Äîlike using deep learning to generate offensive license plates.

---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

title: R-Ladies Cuernavaca: Primer Meetup virtual de R-Ladies Cuernavaca: Generaci√≥n de gr√°ficas con ggplot2
description:
En nuestro primer Meetup virtual de R-Ladies Cuernavaca tendremos una invitada especial, la Dra. Ernestina Godoy Lozano del Instituto Nacional de Salud P√∫blica nos hablar√° sobre c√≥mo generar gr√°ficas con el paquete ggplot2.

Conocimientos necesarios:
- Manejo de Data frames
- Lectura y escritura de archivos en R.

Fecha: Jueves 23 de julio de 2020.

Este evento se llevar√° a cabo mediante Zoom, el link para conectarse al evento ser√° enviado por correo electr√≥nico a los asistentes registrados 30 minutos antes de iniciar. Por seguridad de todos, no compartas el link con personas no registradas en el evento.

Les pedimos conectarse 15 minutos antes para corroborar su inscripci√≥n. Tendremos 15 minutos de tolerancia (hasta las 16:15) para aceptar su entrada al evento una vez comenzada la sesi√≥n.

PROGRAMA
15:45 Conexi√≥n a la sesi√≥n
16:00 Bienvenida.
16:15 Introducci√≥n a ggplot2
17:00 Coffee Break.
17:15 Generaci√≥n de gr√°ficas.

REQUISITOS:
- Leer y atender el c√≥digo de conducta disponible en https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/
- Instalar R y RStudio √∫ltima versi√≥n.
- Instalar el paquete ggplot2 con install.packages("ggplot2").

Si no te es posible asistir al evento, por favor cancela tu inscripci√≥n al menos 24 horas antes para darle oportunidad a las personas en lista de espera. En caso de mantener tu registro y no presentarte al evento, nos veremos en la necesidad de rechazar tu registro en el siguiente meetup.

Agradecemos a nuestros patrocinadores: R Consortium (https://www.r-consortium.org)

title: R-Ladies Den Bosch: R Ladies Netherlands Boook Club - Advanced R - Chapter 9 Functionals
description:
The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up!

Starting in April, we are hosting an online book club. Our first book is Hadley Wickham's Advanced R (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

In our 8th meeting, Martine Jansen from R Ladies Den Bosch will present the key points of Chapter 9: "Functionals". After that, we'll try an exercise together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :) Make sure to read the chapter in advance!

The link to the event meeting will be provided closer to the date.

Online meetings will take place every two weeks. Check the full schedule, previous slides and sign up to present a chapter at this link https://rladiesnl.github.io/book_club/ !

See you soon!

title: R-Ladies Concepci√≥n: C√≥mo hacer una reuni√≥n virtual inolvidable (sin morir en el intento)
description:
Aunque no es posible reunirnos en persona, la magia de R-Ladies no se detiene y hace posible los encuentros virtuales. En este meetup, realizado a las 13:00 hrs Chile, te contaremos algunos trucos y herramientas para que cualquier evento virtual interactivo (por ejemplo, clase, taller o panel online) sea un √©xito sin estr√©s adicional al hacerlo. Si organizas meetups de R-Ladies, encontrar√°s d√≥nde y c√≥mo acceder a la infraestructura que te permitir√° organizar meetups online para tu cap√≠tulo. Si no organizas meetups de R-Ladies, tambi√©n encontrar√°s material √∫til para todo tipo de evento online que organices o del que participes.

Estos contenidos nos los traen R-Ladies latinoamericanas, en su mayor√≠a certificadas para ense√±ar por RStudio Education y The Carpentries. La mayor√≠a tambi√©n es parte de MetaDocencia, una organizaci√≥n que desde fines de marzo realiz√≥ m√°s de 25 talleres interactivos ense√±ando a ense√±ar online a m√°s de 300 docentes hispanohablantes con excelentes resultados. Todas tienen vasta experiencia teletrabajando y ense√±ando online.

Oradoras: Yanina Bellini Saibene y Paola Corrales.

Organizan: Laura Aci√≥n, Yanina Bellini Saibene, Paola Corrales, Patricia Loto y Paloma Rojas

Para tener un evento seguro, el link de acceso al evento lo recibir√°n quienes confirmen su asistencia via RSVP de meetup.com el d√≠a del evento.

title: R-Ladies Concepci√≥n: Sesi√≥n 4 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este s√°bado nos reuniremos para la cuarta sesi√≥n del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valpara√≠so y RLadies Concepci√≥n. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. El libro est√° disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/
- ¬øC√≥mo funciona el club de lectura?
Divideremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. Cada sesi√≥n la liderar√° una relatora de nuestra comunidad.
Esta cuarta sesi√≥n estar√° a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga). Abordaremos las secciones IV y V del libro ("Git Fundamentals" y "Remote setups"). En ellas se abordan algunos conceptos clave (como qu√© es un commit, una rama y un repositorio remoto) y se explica c√≥mo configurar todo para poder colaborar en repositorios de otras personas sin problemas.
- ¬øQu√© necesito para participar?
Lo primero, es leer nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es haber instalado ya Git en tu computador (https://git-scm.com/) y tener una cuenta en GitHub (https://github.com/). Es importante que est√©s segura que puedes utilizar Git desde RStudio. Si te resultaron las actividades de la sesi√≥n 3, entonces tienes todo lo necesario :)
Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesi√≥n.
- ¬øQu√© pasa si no leo en ingl√©s?
¬°Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesi√≥n har√° una s√≠ntesis de los puntos m√°s importantes, as√≠ que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podr√°s aprender sobre este tema :)
- Estoy reci√©n aprendiendo sobre R, ¬øpuedo participar?
S√≠. Si bien el foco de estas sesiones no es programar en R, s√≠ es importante estar familiarizada con RStudio como entorno de trabajo. Si quieres, puedes revisar los v√≠deos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo
¬°Te esperamos!

title: R-Ladies Concepci√≥n: useR! 2020 Tutorial: Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp
description:
The RLadies chapters and the R User Group from Chile are very happy to announce that we will be hosting one of the useR! 2020 online tutorials (https://user2020.r-project.org/program/tutorials/). We will have the honor of having Dirk Eddelbuettel in our meetup, who will be running the tutorial: "Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp" on July 14th, 15:00 UTC.

- Background

R has risen to become the lingua franca of statistical research and applications. At the same time, user demands on computing resources and performance have also increased. This is driven chiefly by the ever-growing size of datasets, and may sometimes be coupled with increases in their complexity. The quest for computing with larger datasets, as well as the ever-present desire to also compute "faster" make complementing the interpreted language-processing at the core of R with native code extensions a natural next step. The Rcpp package has become the principal venue for extending R with compiled code. It makes it easy to extend R with C or C++ spanning the range from simple one-liners to larger routines and bindings of entire external libraries.

- Workshop contents

We will motivate and introduce Rcpp as a natural extension to R that provides an easy-to-use and powerful interface. Helper functions and tools including RStudio will be used to easy creation of R extensions. Several examples will introduce basic use cases including writing code with RcppArmadillo which is the most widely-used package on top of Rcpp.

- Target Audience

R users wanting to go beyond R. Prior experience with compiled languages like C and C++ is helpful but not required.

- About the instructor

Dr Dirk Eddelbuettel has been a (co-)author and maintainer for the Rcpp project since its inception. He works as a senior "quant" in industry combining C++ and R for high-frequency data analysis and predictive models in finance, and teaches a class on Data Science Programming Methods as a Clinical Professor at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He is author, co-author, or maintainer of sixty CRAN packages, an elected board member of the R Foundation, and a 25+ year contributor to Debian looking after 150+ packages including R.

- Attending the workshop

Please, read carefully the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct: https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/. All participants are required to agree to it.

The tutorial will start at 15:OO UTC and has a duration of two hours (+ a 10 minutes break). Check your timezone here: https://arewemeetingyet.com/UTC/2020-07-14/15:00/Seamless%20R%20and%20C%2B%2B%20integration%20with%20Rcpp

[UPDATED SECTION]

We'll be hosting the tutorial on Zoom. The link will be shared in the comments of this event half an hour in advanced. The meeting has a waiting room. We'll let everyone in at 15:00 UTC.

For the tutorial you'll need to install Rcpp from CRAN. You will also need a compiler. Please read sections 1.2 and 1.3 on the second page of the Rcpp FAQ to check specific recommendations for Windows/OSX/Linux users: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/Rcpp/vignettes/Rcpp-FAQ.pdf.

We'll be using RStudio. Is not a bad idea to have an rstudio.cloud account as back-up.

title: Newcastle Upon Tyne Data Science Meetup: July Data Science Meet-up (Virtual)
group: Newcastle Upon Tyne Data Science Meetup
description:
Speaker: Nic Crane (UNAI)

Title:
NLP - Beyond Wordclouds, or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Text Data

Abtract:

Six months ago, I found myself on a new work project, wrestling with a type of data I'd never had to encounter before in the wild: text. Whilst having much in common with tabular data, this unstructured format has many of its own special quirks and idiosyncrasies. Now, on the precipice of project completion, I reflect on the challenges I faced, how I overcame them, and share the libraries, techniques, and resources that were instrumental in getting me there.

title: Chico R Users Group: Community Coding
description:
Coding is a social activity! Got data and working on analysis? Got questions on using R or other programming languages? Great way to dedicate time to working on that project you've been meaning to get around to. Come and hang out with other coders in a welcoming and supportive environment

Students, staff, faculty, and the public are invited to join our Community Coding sessions. Bring your computer, coding projects, and your questions to this open working environment.

Sponsored by the CSUC Data Science Initiative. Learn more at http://datascience.csuchico.edu

title: Orange County R Users Group (OCRUG): Book club - Session 11 - Applied Predictive Modeling
description:
The book club is to motivate us to read books and discussing them together. This will help all of us to develop our skills. Xi Chen will be heading up the book club.

The format will be that the leader will prepare a short summary of the material and present it to the group. We will then discuss the material and do some exercises.

The expectations are that you will attend regularly once you sign up for a book. If you cannot, please wait until the next round starts with a new book. It is also expected that participants will take turns being the leader.

We will meet each week, Wednesday evening between 6:30 to 8:00 PM. The location is Zoom if we cannot meet in person. If we can meet, it will be at Panara Bread (see below)

Book: Applied Predictive Modeling
http://appliedpredictivemodeling.com/
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00K15TZU0/

What to bring
* Laptop with R installed
* Book

title: Central Iowa R User Group: R and Python study group
description:
Until we can meet again in person, please join our Slack workspace to stay in touch, ask questions, and share information throughout the week.

https://join.slack.com/t/centraliowarusergroup/shared_invite/zt-dhfa5ude-0tvHascxRkn2pgiqDdQgrw

The Slack workspace is available any time, not just Saturday mornings.

Are you tired of learning and playing with Python and R alone? Would you like to get together with a few friends and learn together? I have been starting to learn R and Python for data science and following the typical route of videos and practice projects. I really want to ramp up my learning and exposure to different ways. Here is my proposal:

- Gather a small group of 2-5 and learn together.

title: STWUR - Wroclaw R Users Group Meetup: Why R? 2020 Conference - Remote!
group: STWUR - Wroclaw R Users Group Meetup
description:
[REGISTRATION STARTS JUNE 1st] - whyr.pl/2020/register/
[SUBMISSIONS STARTS JUNE 1st] - whyr.pl/2020/submit/

We will stream the conference at youtube.com/WhyRFoundation

Why R? 2020 Conference, the fourth meeting of R enthusiasts. It will be held remotely, 24-27 September 2020. As the meeting is held in English, we are happy to invite R users from all over the globe!

Why R? 2020 Conference is an international event of R statistical software users. It is a remarkable occasion to gain knowledge about R, enhance data analysis and processing skills, and meet other members of European R community.

title: Spotkania Entuzjast√≥w R-Warsaw RUG Meetup & R-Ladies Warsaw: Supporting grant for Women in Data Science
group: Spotkania Entuzjast√≥w R-Warsaw RUG Meetup & R-Ladies Warsaw
description:
# Website
http://whyr.pl/foundation/supporting-grant/

# Motivation
The aim of the Why R? Foundation is to reinforce the growth of data science in Poland by keeping it balanced and diverse. To do so, since 2018 Why R? Foundation is distributing the Why R? Supporting Grant for Woman in Data Science. The idea is not only to aid exceptional female data scientists but also to showcase them as role models to the whole community.

# Dates

- Grant Applications should be submitted through a dedicated form by 16th August 2020.
- Grant Holder selection information will be published by 20th September 2020 on the Why R? Foundation‚Äôs website.

Grant Applicants will be notified about decisions by an e-mail.

# Terms and Conditions
Terms and Conditions of award and disbursement of Why R? Foundation grants for exceptional women scientists from the field of data science are available here http://whyr.pl/foundation/terms-and-conditions.pdf

# Registration form
If you want to apply for the grant please fill this form https://forms.gle/pHrFD7DL7cHC1N2z7

# Scientific committee
Micha≈Ç Burdukiewicz (amanuensis)
Marta Karas
Marcin Kosi≈Ñski
Barbara Sobkowiak
Partners

# Partners
Women in Machine Learning and Data Science Poland
RLadies Warsaw

# Acknowledgements
Terms and Conditions of award and disbursement of Why R? Foundation grants for exceptional women scientists from the field of data science were prepared by Le≈õniewski, Borkiewicz & Partners. Le≈õniewski, Borkiewicz & Partners is a modern, boutique law firm with a business approach. LB&P works mainly with clients from IT, TMT and e-commerce areas, both within defined projects and as a comprehensive, ongoing service. The main areas of LB&P specialization are negotiating commercial contracts, mergers, acquisitions and restructuring (M&A), personal data protection, legal support in the field of designing mobile applications, image and personal rights protection, cybersecurity, compliance and taxes. For more details please check a website lbplegal.com or LB&P LinkedIn account. https://www.linkedin.com/company/lbplegal/

title: Montreal R User Group: [Webinar] Interpretable Machine Learning for Enterprise Applications
description:
Register here: https://bit.ly/2CfWz58

This webinar will focus on showing how leading companies leverage Machine Learning and Data Science in multiple industries.

Our speakers will:

- Show how to build interpretable time series models
- Cover the most common problems in enterprise operations
- Address AI applications in clinical development

Schedule:

11:00-11:30 AM PDT:
Interpretable Forecasting Models: Decomposition of Demand and Other Enterprise Time Series by Ilya Katsov, Head of Data Science, Grid Dynamics

11:30-12:00 PM PDT :
Disease Interception: AI Applications in Clinical Development by Christel Chehoud, Director of Data Science, Analytics & Insights at Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

Register here: https://bit.ly/2CfWz58

title: Montreal R User Group: DSS virtual: Media, Advertising & Entertainment
description:
Register here: https://www.datascience.salon/media-advertising-and-entertainment/

Join us this fall for a 4-day virtual salon, focused on Media, Advertising & Entertainment. The series will include plenty of networking opportunities, meditation breaks, coffee chats, food demonstrations, breakout sessions and giveaways.

Click here to register or learn more: https://www.datascience.salon/media-advertising-and-entertainment/

title: Montreal R User Group: [Virtual] NLP Summit
description:
Register here: https://www.nlpsummit.org/

Join the NLP Summit: two weeks of immersive, industry-focused content. Week one will include over 30 unique sessions, with a special track on NLP in Healthcare. Week two will feature beginner to advanced training workshops with certifications. Attendees can also participate in a datathon and join coffee chats with speakers, committers, and industry experts.

Register here: https://www.nlpsummit.org/

title: Zurich R User Group: SummeR BeeR @ El Lokal
description:
The world has changed. The epidemiological, social, economic and geopolitical effects of the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic will linger on for a long time. ... We are planning to try to bring back a bit of normality by organizing a social gathering at El Lokal (Gessner-Allee 11, Z√ºrich), for the first time in many months. Meet enthusiastic R users & have fun. Hope to see you there!

- What to bring: Good mood.

- Location: El Lokal, Gessner-Allee 11, Z√ºrich, http://www.ellokal.ch/

- IMPORTANT: The event is weather INdependent!

Apologies for the short notice, we still hope you can make it and enjoy an evening with the local R community.

title: Grupo de Usuarios de R de Madrid: EncuentRos en la fase R - Evento on-line
group: Grupo de Usuarios de R de Madrid
description:
Buenas a todos,

Estamos preparando un evento online que tendr√° lugar entre el viernes 18 y s√°bado 19 de septiembre.

Este evento lo estamos organizando por R-hispano, la asociaci√≥n de usuarios de R de Espa√±a (http://r-es.org/), y
patrocinado por U-TAD, Centro Universitario de Tecnolog√≠a y Arte Digital
(https://www.u-tad.com/)

Este encuentRo, enteramente online y accesible de forma gratuita a trav√©s de internet, previa inscripci√≥n, tiene como objetivo facilitar la comunicaci√≥n de los trabajos de los distintos grupos locales de R-hispano (http://r-es.org/grupos-locales/ ) y en general promover el uso del entorno de an√°lisis estad√≠stico y machine learning R en toda la comunidad de habla hispana.

Ya tenemos algunos elementos de la agenda definidos, pero seguimos trabajando para completarla tanto con presentaciones de los diferentes grupos de R de Espa√±a, como con participaciones de "estrellas invitadas".

Confiamos que la disponibilidad del evento por internet facilitar√° la asistencia de todas las personas interesadas en este apasionante campo, y difundir las muchas oportunidades que plantean tanto las comunidades locales como las instituciones que forman y apoyan R-hispano.

Conforme ya tengamos detalles m√°s detalles de la agenda, totalmente confirmados, os iremos informando.

Gracias a todos e inscribiros!.

Nota: para la inscripci√≥n pode√≠s usar esta URL:
https://www.u-tad.com/event/save-the-date-encuentros-r/

description:
Join us as we explore the features and packages of the R programming language. All skill levels are welcomed. We are still putting together details for this particular meeting, but if have a topic you would like to talk about, please let us know!

title: Salt Lake City R Users Group: [ONLINE] Productionizing R code with Docker at Intermountain Healthcare
group: Salt Lake City R Users Group
description:
Our August Meetup will be a remote gathering. The Zoom link will be posted the week of the event.

Often the gap between data science and software or data engineering can make setting up R environments properly a challenge; you can spend weeks of coordination to get your data science project code into production. Docker can be used to containerize your R code projects and make the transition between development code into production a cinch. This talk will cover some basics in Docker commands and demonstrate how to set up containers for Rscript batch processing and R plumber APIs.

Mark Nielsen is currently a Data Scientist at Intermountain Healthcare and is leading the development of ML Engineering pipelines for better implementation of machine learning into patient and caregiver workflows.

title: Oslo useR! Group: [Online] Item Response Theory in R ‚Äì Modelling test results
description:
[About the event]
In this talk, Henrik will present a statistical paradigm called Item Response Theory (IRT). IRT is the preferred statistical framework for modelling educational and psychological scales. In education, IRT is the statistical method used in international assessment programs like PISA and national assessments such as the national tests in Norway. The talk will focus on applications of IRT, specifically making results on different tests comparable and the fairness of educational tests.

[About the speaker]
Henrik Galligani R√¶der is a doctoral research fellow at the Centre for Educational Measurement at the University in Oslo (CEMO), Norway. His research focuses on the Norwegian national assessments, vertical scaling of educational tests and the numeracy proficiency of Norwegian students.

title: New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup: That Feeling of Workflowing
group: New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup
description:
We are staying virtual to kick off R Week, with Miles McBain coming to us from Australia, following in the footsteps of Rob Hyndman, Earo Wang and Di Cook.

Thank you to EcoHealth Alliance for providing the Zoom link.

This is the first event of the week, with our Sixth Annual R Conference and Workshops taking place that Wednesday through Saturday, 12th-15th. The workshops cover machine learning in both R and Python, web scraping, shiny, GIS, git and the tidyverse. Speakers include Andrew Gelman, Emily Dodwell, Jon Krohn, Emily Robinson, Wes McKinney, Ludmila Janda, David Robinson and too many more to list here. Visit https://rstats.ai/nyr/ for more information and use code nyhackr for a 20% discount.

About the Talk:
When would you use an R notebook versus a project dependency graph solver? Should everything be an R package? What can your R project workflow optimise for, and which properties of your work can this affect?

Despite the importance of questions like these to having a happy and productive time with R, there is little community consensus on the principles for establishing R project workflows.

We will begin the session by examining these questions and mapping out workflow styles served by existing R tooling. In the second half I will demonstrate practical productivity boosters my team and I have implemented along the way to a workflow centered on {drake}.

About Miles:
I'm a Data Scientist at Queensland Fire and Emergency Services where I use R to identify and analyse investment options in our emergency services network. Since I started programming in R about 5 years ago I've become an active #rstats tweeter, blogger, and RWeekly editor. I was an organiser of a local meetup group, three rOpensci OzUnconferences, and useR! 2018 Brisbane. I release R packages that do extremely niche things. Everyone's favourite is {datapasta} but {fnmate} is probably the one I get the most personal joy out of. I am into workflows because of their capacity to change the way work feels.

The talk will begin at 7 and we will start admitting people to the event shortly before. Since this is completely remote there will be no pizza but everyone is encouraged to have pizza individually.

title: R-Ladies Santiago: C√≥mo preparar una propuesta de presentaci√≥n para una conferencia/meetup sobre R
description:
La realizaci√≥n de conferencias y meetups sobre R en modalidad virtual es una excelente oportunidad para que grupos menos representados en nuestra comunidad participen en estas instancias. Para muchas personas, la imposibilidad de viajar --sea por la raz√≥n que sea-- ha sido un impedimento para poder ser parte de estas actividades. Ahora tenemos una oportunidad que es importante que aprovochemos. Pero ¬øc√≥mo preparar una propuesta? ¬øQu√© debiese incluir el abstract? ¬øPara qu√© conferencia es m√°s apropiada la idea que tengo? ¬øQu√© deber√≠a tener en cuenta al pensar una propuesta de presentaci√≥n para un meetup? ¬øEs lo mismo escribir un abstract para una conferencia de R que para una conferencia en mi disciplina? ¬øQu√© tengo que incluir en la Bio? Para responder estas preguntas y compartir algunas recomendaciones para dise√±ar tu propuesta nos juntaremos el pr√≥ximo s√°bado 1 de agosto :)

- ¬øY si todav√≠a no tengo una idea para una presentaci√≥n?

No importa. Durante la sesi√≥n hablaremos tambi√©n sobre c√≥mo generar ideas. Adem√°s, para el caso de algunas conferencias hay tiempo todav√≠a. Quiz√°s ahora mismo no se te ocurre nada en particular, pero puedes empezar a planear un proyecto para presentar en alguno de los eventos del pr√≥ximo a√±o.

- ¬øQu√© necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish. Queremos que nuestros meetups sean un espacio seguro y amable en que todas las personas se sientan c√≥modas participando.

Lo segundo, es asegurarte de que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesi√≥n.

- ¬øHay algo m√°s que deba saber sobre este evento?

Esta es una actividad organizada por los cap√≠tulos de RLadies de Chile en conjunto con LatinR (https://latin-r.com/), la Conferencia Latinoamericana sobre Uso de R en Investigaci√≥n + Desarrollo. Queremos m√°s representaci√≥n de Latinoam√©rica en las conferencias de R alrededor del mundo y qu√© mejor que apoyarnos como comunidad para lograrlo.

El taller estar√° a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga).

title: R-Ladies Philly: Hands-on Machine Learning Workshop
description:
Researchers utilize high-dimensional biological data for questions ranging from identifying groups of interest to extracting biologically meaningful representations. This hands-on unsupervised machine learning workshop will introduce concepts such as cluster validation and stability, dimensionality reduction, and representation learning for transcriptomics.

About our speaker:

Jaclyn Taroni is a Principal Data Scientist at the Childhood Cancer Data Lab, an initiative of Alex's Lemonade Stand Foundation. She was a Postdoctoral Researcher in the Greene Lab at the University of Pennsylvania Perelman School of Medicine, where she worked on cross-platform normalization of gene expression data and unsupervised transfer learning for rare diseases. She conducted her thesis work in the Whitfield Lab at the Geisel School of Medicine at Dartmouth studying the rare autoimmune disease systemic sclerosis, where she developed novel frameworks for analyzing high-throughput molecular data from multiple tissues, clinical manifestations, and drug trials. (http://www.jaclyn-taroni.com/)

title: R-Ladies Philly: Decision Trees & Random Forests
description:
DESCRIPTION:

Decision trees are easy to understand and form the basis for random forest, a powerful machine learning technique. We will build decision tree and random forest models to discover trends using the Philadelphia Police Department‚Äôs Complaints Against Police dataset. Please note that we are using the dataset to illustrate statistical and programming techniques and do not have the background in criminal justice to draw any conclusions from our models.

SPEAKER:

Alexandra Parfitt is a graduate student in applied statistics at Villanova University. She is completing a co-op at GlaxoSmithKline in chemical, manufacturing and controls statistics in the biopharmaceutical division. She entered data science and statistics after working in the humanities and she holds an AB from the University of Chicago and a PhD from Yale in comparative literature. She lives in Ardmore with her husband and their four-year-old daughter.

title: R-Ladies Toronto: Open data and an interactive dashboard to monitor COVID-19 outbreak in Canada
description:
We are so excited to be back!

On August 12, Isha Berry will be talking about be talking about "Open access epidemiological data and an interactive dashboard to monitor the COVID-19 outbreak in Canada".

This meetup is, of course, online, and a link to the Zoom meeting will be shared the day of the event.

Approximate agenda:
7 - 7:10pm: Welcome and announcements
7:10 - 7:30pm: Isha's talk
7:30 - 7:45pm: Q&A and discussion
7:45 - 8:00pm: Wrap up

Talk description:
The COVID-19 Canada Open Data Working Group was founded in March 2020 in response to the need for accurate, up-to-date and accessible data on the COVID-19 epidemic in Canada. Unlike many datasets that provide only aggregate case counts, the working group dataset collects individual-level case data, which are particularly valuable during outbreaks but are seldom made available in real time. This dataset feeds into an interactive dashboard, which enables users to visualize the data and identify key health outcome trends.

The dataset and dashboard have become a reliable pan-Canadian source for COVID-19 information. Additionally, this has the potential for future linkages with diverse datasets, such as policy interventions, socio-behavioural changes, environmental factors, and other population-level factors. The open access aspect of this work encourages transparency and data sharing, which are crucial for supporting evidence-based control strategies and directing public health response efforts in Canada for the COVID-19 pandemic.

This talk will provide an overview of the key features associated with the COVID-19 Canada Open Data Working Group datasets and feature a demonstration of the tools available on the R Shiny dashboard. We will also discuss some of the key epidemiological insights that have been
observed from this data and dashboard to date.

About Isha Berry:
Isha Berry is a PhD Candidate in Epidemiology at the Dalla Lana School of Public Health and a Fellow in the Emerging Leaders in Biosecurity Initiative at the Johns Hopkins Centre for Health Security. She is a co-founder of the COVID-19 Canada Open Data Working Group, which leads digital surveillance of COVID-19 cases in Canada to curate a publicly available line list and public-facing data dashboard. Isha has expertise in infectious disease epidemiology, geo-spatial methods, and mathematical modelling. Her primary area of research is understanding the socio-behavioral drivers of global emerging infectious diseases. She has experience conducting infectious disease research in low-, middle-, and high-income settings. She holds an MSc in Epidemiology from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine and a BSc in Environmental Science from McGill University.

---

Please note that by attending you agree to abide by our code of conduct: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

title: R-Ladies Cambridge: Reproducible computation at scale with drake
description:
The techniques in this tutorial enhance the maintainability, hygiene, speed, scale, and reproducibility of complicated projects with long runtimes. The drake R package resolves the dependency structure of data analysis pipelines, skips tasks that are already up to date, and cleanly organizes the output. Workflows with drake are efficient to maintain, and they provide tangible evidence that the results are synchronized with the underlying code and data, which increases one‚Äôs ability to trust the conclusions of the research.

Learning objectives:
1. Function-oriented programming: participants will learn to express data analysis tasks as user-defined
functions, experience the advantages of functions relative to imperative scripts, and understand the role
of functions in drake-powered projects.
2. Declarative workflows: students will declare targets to represent data analysis artifacts, identify the
dependencies of those targets, and inspect the emergent dependency structures of entire workflows.
3. Project maintenance: students will experience drake‚Äôs responses to changing code and data, and they
will understand the conditions that allow drake to skip computation and save time.
4. Large plans: participants will practice declaring large collections of targets compactly using drake‚Äôs
domain-specific language.

Computing requirements:
Each participant must have a laptop with a web browser and the ability to connect to the internet. Students will spend most of their time
working through R notebooks and supporting Shiny applications.
‚Ä¢ notebooks: https://github.com/wlandau/learndrake/tree/master/inst/notebooks
‚Ä¢ learndrakeflow app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/learndrakeflow
‚Ä¢ learndrakeplans app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/learndrakeplans
‚Ä¢ drakeplanner app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/drakeplanner
Online RStudio Server instances will be provided so participants can interact with the notebooks without
needing to install anything locally.

The instructor:
Will Landau received his PhD in Statistics at Iowa State University in 2016. His dissertation research
introduced a novel fully Bayesian, hierarchical model-driven, GPU-accelerated approach to the analysis of heterosis gene expression data (Landau, Niemi, and Nettleton 2019). He currently works at Eli Lilly and
Company, where he develops capabilities for clinical statisticians.
Will is the creator and maintainer of rOpenSci‚Äôs drake R package. His most recent presentations on drake are the rOpenSci Community Call on September 24, 2019 (video recording at https://ropensci.org/commcalls/
2019-09-24) (Landau and Butland 2019) and a half-day workshop at R/Pharma 2019 (Landau 2019).

https://www.linkedin.com/in/wlandau/
https://wlandau.github.io
https://github.com/wlandau

title: R-Ladies Freiburg: Intro to Shiny!
description:
In this meetup we will do an introductory walkthrough of Shiny apps.

Shiny is a web development platform developed through R Studio that allows R users to make interactive interfaces for data manipulation and visualization. Some great examples of what can be done using Shiny can be found here https://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/.

During the tutorial we will introduce Shiny and build a first Shiny App together. R-users of all levels are welcome, only basic experience with R and R-Studio is necessary.

Important!
The meetup will be hosted online via Zoom -- the link will be sent out via Meetup around 15 minutes before the start time.

title: R-Ladies Oslo: Statistrikk: Hard facts by soft materials
description:
Kathrine Frey Fr√∏slie is an associate professor at NMBU (Norwegian University of Life Sciences) and a knitting blogger! Of course she codes in R, and of course she knits what she codes!

"What would a knitted ggplot of the Norwegian Birth Registry's monthly numbers look like?", you may ask. Come to this talk and find out.

Check out her blog at https://www.statistrikk.no!

We have the opportunity to provide child-care during the event. Please contact us if you would like us to arrange this.

title: R-Ladies Valpara√≠so: C√≥mo preparar una propuesta de presentaci√≥n para una conferencia/meetup sobre R
description:
La realizaci√≥n de conferencias y meetups sobre R en modalidad virtual es una excelente oportunidad para que grupos menos representados en nuestra comunidad participen en estas instancias. Para muchas personas, la imposibilidad de viajar --sea por la raz√≥n que sea-- ha sido un impedimento para poder ser parte de estas actividades. Ahora tenemos una oportunidad que es importante que aprovochemos. Pero ¬øc√≥mo preparar una propuesta? ¬øQu√© debiese incluir el abstract? ¬øPara qu√© conferencia es m√°s apropiada la idea que tengo? ¬øQu√© deber√≠a tener en cuenta al pensar una propuesta de presentaci√≥n para un meetup? ¬øEs lo mismo escribir un abstract para una conferencia de R que para una conferencia en mi disciplina? ¬øQu√© tengo que incluir en la Bio? Para responder estas preguntas y compartir algunas recomendaciones para dise√±ar tu propuesta nos juntaremos el pr√≥ximo s√°bado 1 de agosto :)

- ¬øY si todav√≠a no tengo una idea para una presentaci√≥n?

No importa. Durante la sesi√≥n hablaremos tambi√©n sobre c√≥mo generar ideas. Adem√°s, para el caso de algunas conferencias hay tiempo todav√≠a. Quiz√°s ahora mismo no se te ocurre nada en particular, pero puedes empezar a planear un proyecto para presentar en alguno de los eventos del pr√≥ximo a√±o.

- ¬øQu√© necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish. Queremos que nuestros meetups sean un espacio seguro y amable en que todas las personas se sientan c√≥modas participando.

Lo segundo, es asegurarte de que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesi√≥n.

- ¬øHay algo m√°s que deba saber sobre este evento?

Esta es una actividad organizada por los cap√≠tulos de RLadies de Chile en conjunto con LatinR (https://latin-r.com/), la Conferencia Latinoamericana sobre Uso de R en Investigaci√≥n + Desarrollo. Queremos m√°s representaci√≥n de Latinoam√©rica en las conferencias de R alrededor del mundo y qu√© mejor que apoyarnos como comunidad para lograrlo.

El taller estar√° a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga).

title: R-Ladies Madrid: Conversemos sobre violencia intrafamiliar
description:
Hola, r-ladies!

Nuestras compa√±eras de Barranquilla nos animaron a participar en este meetup con los datos de Espa√±a y no hemos querido dejar pasar esta ocasi√≥n de colaborar en un asunto tan importante. Sabemos que es un meetup un tanto inusual porque ser√° 1) en pleno verano 2) online 3) sobre m√°s un tema social y menos t√©cnico que de costumbre, pero creemos que puede ser muy interesante.

Se trata de una mesa redonda en la que analizaremos la situaci√≥n actual de Colombia, M√©xico y Espa√±a referente a los casos de violencia intrafamiliar durante la cuarentena debido al COVID-19. Presentaremos dashboards elaborados con RStudio donde se pueden visualizar todas las estad√≠sticas correspondientes a cada uno de los pa√≠ses, y mostraremos los resultados y las variaciones en los √≠ndices de violencia.

Contaremos con la presencia de profesionales, quienes nos ayudar√°n a analizar la situaci√≥n por medio de preguntas y comentarios del p√∫blico asistente para que desde la √≥ptica profesional tengamos un acercamiento de lo que pueden ser las causas o condiciones que ocasionan el posible incremento de la violencia en medio de la pandemia.

El meetup se realizar√° por la plataforma virtual ZOOM; el enlace se compartir√° minutos antes del evento.

title: R-Ladies Guayaquil: Machine learning con mlr3 - Tutorial en l√≠nea de useR!2020
description:
Las R-Ladies Ecuador te traemos el tutorial 'Machine learning con mlr3' que dictar√°n Bernd Bischl y Michel Lang, el cual es parte de useR! 2020.

En este tutorial con duraci√≥n de tres horas, aprender√°s sobre el paquete mlr3 de R para llevar a cabo procesos de aprendizaje autom√°tico (machine learning, ML) avanzados. El ecosistema mlr3 provee una soluci√≥n completa para todas tus necesidades de ML, incluyendo pre-procesamiento de datos, dise√±o y evaluaci√≥n de modelos de aprendizaje autom√°tico, conjuntos de modelos (ensembles), visualizaciones, y ajuste de hiperpar√°metros (a trav√©s de mlr3tuning). El proceso (pipeline) mlr3pipelines permite expresar flujos de trabajo complejos de manera sencilla, y probar nuevas ideas y aplicaciones. mlr3 puede ayudar a hacer tu flujo de trabajo m√°s f√°cil de leer y m√°s eficiente sin importar el tipo de problema o aplicaci√≥n que quieras resolver con ML.

Este tutorial est√° dirigido a usuarios con un conocimiento de conceptos b√°sicos de aprendizaje autom√°tico (machine learning), pero no necesariamente debes tener conocimiento previo del paquete mlr3. Los participantes tambi√©n deber√°n tener al menos un conocimiento intermedio de R y conocer los tipos de datos generales utilizados por R, as√≠ como habilidad para llevar a cabo operaciones b√°sicas. Es preferible que tengan experiencia con R6 y data.table, pero no es esencial.

Puedes acceder al material del curso a trav√©s del repositorio de GitHub: https://github.com/mlr-org/user2020 . Puedes descargar los material con antelaci√≥n para que puedas seguir el curso en vivo, o para practicar los ejercicios en cualquier otro momento. El tutorial ser√° en ingl√©s, pero tendremos subt√≠tulos disponibles en espa√±ol para que nos puedas seguir con facilidad.

Recuerda que al participar en nuestros eventos deber√°s aceptar el c√≥digo de conducta de R-Ladies ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct ), as√≠ como el de useR! 2020 ( https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/ ).

Nuestros eventos est√°n abiertos a todos los miembros de la comunidad de R, pero incentivamos particularmente a mujeres y miembros de grupos minoritarios a registrarse con nosotras.

**English**
R-Ladies Ecuador is bringing you the online tutorial: 'Machine learning con mlr3' taught by Bernd Bischl and Michel Lang, which is part of useR! 2020.

In this three hour tutorial you will be introduced to the mlr3 R package for modern, state-of-the-art machine learning (ML). The mlr3 ecosystem provides a one-stop solution for all ML needs, spanning preprocessing, model learning and evaluation, ensembles, visualization, and hyperparameter tuning (via mlr3tuning). Its pipeline system mlr3pipelines allows to easily express complex workflows, and to quickly prototype new ideas and applications. Whether you are applying ML to solve a practical prediction problem, implementing learning algorithms as a research software engineer or researching ML by empirical means, mlr3 can help make your workflow more readable and efficient.

We target to users with at least basic knowledge of ML concepts who are not yet familiar with mlr3. We require a working knowledge of R at medium level. One should know R's general type system and basic operations. Some experience with R6 and data.table definitely help, but is not essential.

You can access all course material through GitHub: https://github.com/mlr-org/user2020 . You can dowload all the material prior to the course so you can follow the instructions live, or you can also use the materials to practice exercises on your own time. The tutorial will be taught in English, but subtitles will be available.

When you participate in our events, remember that you are accepting the R-Ladies code of conduct ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct ) as well as that from useR! 2020 ( https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/ ).

Everyone is welcome, but we encourage women and people from minority groups to join our events.

title: R-Ladies Amsterdam: [ONLINE] Function Factories! R-Ladies NL book club Advanced R Chapter 10
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Sarah Stolle will present the key points of Chapter 10: ‚ÄúFunction Factories". After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Add questions and expectations in the collaborative HackMD:
https://hackmd.io/jwzoC61qRTOn8C3t3_X-kA?both

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT SARAH
----------------------
Sarah has a history in molecular life science and learned R during her PhD studies in the Biology of Ageing. After her academic studies she transitioned into a career in Data Science. She now works as a Data Scientist for Heineken in Amsterdam. Her main programming language at the moment is Python, but she keeps her love for R alive through R-Ladies and in personal projects.
